predicate.note: Frames file for 'sniff' based on sentences in wsj and automatic expansion via verbnet.

example.name: didn't think this would actually occur
example.text: ``Texans can sniff a phony a mile away,'' the narrator warns outsiders.

example.name: love this example
example.text: ``She just wiggled her fanny and all the French fell in love with her,'' sniffed *trace* the literary world's Maria Jolas, not entirely inaccurately.
example.arg: *trace* -> She just wiggled her fanny and all the French fell in love with her

roleset.name: find

example.name: seek and destroy
example.text: Their stock in trade as ``executive producers'' is sniffing out hot properties, locking them up and then getting big studios to bankroll and distribute them.

roleset.note: Actually arg0 should be 'they' but that's not available.
